titleStmt.title: A discourse of the Queenes Maiesties entertainement in Suffolk and Norffolk with a description of many things then presently seene. Deuised by Thomas Churchyarde, Gent. with diuers shewes of his own inuention sette out at Norwich: and some rehearsal of hir Highnesse retourne from progresse. Wherevnto is adioyned a commendation of Sir Humfrey Gilberts ventrous iourney.
titleStmt.author: Churchyard, Thomas, 1520?-1604.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Henrie Bynneman, seruante to the right Honourable Sir Christofer Hatton Vizchamberlayne,

notesStmt.note: "A welcome home to Master Martin Frobusher" begins on L1.
H1 is a cancel in all copies, with a list of new knights on the verso.
Heading of dedication varies: to (1) William Iarret; (2) Gilbert Gerard; (3) Gilbert Gerrard.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

person.persName: Henrie Bynneman, seruante to the right Honourable Sir Christofer Hatton Vizchamberlayne
